thread.title: Bob Saget back on Broadway as a pastor in 'Hand to God'
thread.title_full: Bob Saget back on Broadway as a pastor in 'Hand to God' - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Bob Saget back on Broadway as a pastor in 'Hand to God'
text:
Bob Saget will play a pastor in "Hand to God." Notoriously filthy comic Bob Saget is about to meet his match on Broadway: Tyone, the possessive potty-mouthed puppet in “Hand to God.”
Saget, best known for the family-friendly TV show “Full House” but whose raunchy side comes out in his standup routines, joins the cast of Roberts Askins’ hit comedy on Nov. 3.
“I’ve been wanting so much to come back to Broadway, especially if the material was just too good to resist,” Saget, who appeared in the musical “The Drowsy Chaperone” on Broadway in 2007, said in a statement.
“After seeing ‘Hand to God’ with my daughters, I knew immediately that I'd pounce at the opportunity to be a part of it if I could. Didn't see it coming but (I am) beyond delighted.”
Michael Oberholtzer, Geneva Carr, Steven Boyer, Marc Kudisch, and Sarah Stiles in "Hand to God." Saget takes over for Marc Kudisch, who’s leaving to work on the play “Baritones Unbound,” which he conceived and co-wrote.
“Hand to God” runs through Jan. 3 in New York, then before transfers to the West End. Performances in London begin Feb. 5.
jdziemianowicz@nydailynews.com
